### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: I ca n't imagine a better-written treatment of the subject .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: treatment of the subject
	- sentiment_expression: better-written
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: I
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

text: I really like it.Be forewarned ( as other reviews have noted ) , this book sets up Magician 's End and you will not be particularly satisfied with the ending without keeping this in mind .

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: If you 're into Diana books I 'd keep this one last after you 've read the rest .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: diana books
	- sentiment_expression: keep this one last
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: after you 've read the rest
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book

	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author

	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: Here , we see that aspect of the tale really expanded upon , elevating a lackluster minor plot thread to a level of significance worthy of Midkemia 's final chapter .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: aspect of the tale
	- sentiment_expression: expanded upon
	- target_entity: plot
	- aspect_category: storyline
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: Here , we see that aspect of the tale really expanded upon , elevating a lackluster minor plot thread to a level of significance worthy of Midkemia 's final chapter .
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: elevating a lackluster minor plot thread to a level of significance worthy of Midkemia 's final chapter .

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:

	- Opinion N

2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:

	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

text: I have had this on my shelf for several years for intended reading : Had I appreciated what a compelling narrative Mukherjee sets out , and how well he tells it , I would have read it much sooner.As there are numerous , good reviews of this exceptional book , I will not pile on , except to say that this is a comprehensive and detailed treatment for the non-expert , that manages to explain the science ( and some of the politics ) with clarity , while providing a compelling and often moving narrative .

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1

	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author

	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: It 's a good place and will definitely consider to come again .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: good place
	- target_entity: location
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: will definitely consider to come again

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:

	- aspect_term: N/A

	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.

**Annotated Output**:

	- aspect_term: cleanliness
	- sentiment_expression: super clean
	- target_entity: environment
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.

	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author

	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:

	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

- Opinion 2

	- target_entity: keyboard

	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: They hold up great !

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: hold up great
	- target_entity: objects
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.

- Opinion 2

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

	- opinion_holder_span: i

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: nice
	- target_entity: product
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: Order 1 size larger than needed .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: order size
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: food
	- aspect_category: portion_size
	- sentiment_polarity: negative
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: Order 1 size larger than needed

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: Images are too dark and blurry .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: images
	- sentiment_expression: too dark and blurry
	- target_entity: images
	- aspect_category: visual_quality
	- sentiment_polarity: negative
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: Please do not purchase this computer , it performs worse than the $ 200 computer I used while waiting on the ' replacement ' computer I got when the other one crashed .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: computer
	- sentiment_expression: performs worse
	- target_entity: computer
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: negative
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: Please do not purchase this computer
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: it performs worse than the $ 200 computer I used while waiting on the ' replacement ' computer I got when the other one crashed

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: $ 200 computer
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: computer
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: while waiting on the ' replacement ' computer I got when the other one crashed
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: I had hoped for better battery life , as it had only about 2-1/2 hours doing heavy computations ( 8 threads using 100 % of the CPU ) .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: battery life
	- sentiment_expression: hoped for better
	- target_entity: device
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: negative
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: I
	- opinion_holder_entity: user
	- opinion_qualifier: doing heavy computations ( 8 threads using 100 % of the CPU )
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.

	- aspect_category: customer_service
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: I
	- opinion_holder_entity: customer
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

	- opinion_holder_span: N/A

	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.

**Annotated Output**:

	- opinion_holder_entity: author

- Opinion 2

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N

		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:

3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author

	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: So , while I would n't quite recommend it for date night or a rehearsal dinner , it 's plenty acceptable for grabbing a quick lunch or dinner on your way somewhere else .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: restaurant
	- sentiment_expression: acceptable
	- target_entity: restaurant
	- aspect_category: dining_experience
	- sentiment_polarity: neutral
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: So , while I would n't quite recommend it for date night or a rehearsal dinner ,
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: quick lunch or dinner on your way somewhere else
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: Walking by on E. Hastings , it 's easy to miss this spot

### Format Guidelines:

	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: The chicken was also overcooked and dry .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: chicken
	- sentiment_expression: overcooked and dry
	- target_entity: food
	- aspect_category: food_quality
	- sentiment_polarity: negative
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A
